person_010.name: Catherine MariaFanshawe
person_010.description: English poet, author and artist who copied poems into Davy's notebook under the pseudonym 'Fidelissima'.

person_002.name: AnnaBeddoes
person_002.description: Anna Beddoes, n√©e Edgeworth, the wife of Thomas Beddoes who befriended Davy when he arrived in Bristol. Critics have speculated that they had an affair because Davy wrote poems to Anna and she wrote poems for him that he copied out in his notebooks.

person_035.name: Homer
person_035.description: Homer was a Greek poet who is believed to have written the epic poems, the Iliad and the Odyssey.

person_106.name: WilliamWynne
person_106.description: Lawyer, Dean of the Arches and later Master of Trinity Hall, Cambridge. Knighted 1788. FRSL.

place_002.name: Ontario
place_002.description: Ontario is a province in east-central Canada.

place_177.name: Andes
place_177.description: Mountain range in western South America.

otherwork_159.name: The hoary priest even / at the altar shot' is a line from Sir Walter Scott's poem The Vision of Don Roderick. Scott reviewed Davy's Salmonia in the Quarterly Review. He was a friend of Davy.
otherwork_159.author: Sir Walter Scott
